gpio_expander_adapters.py
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 """
2 Set of classes which allow to manage GPIO pins as if they were MCP expander's pins
3 
4 This module is meant to grow depending on the needs to mimic the MCP manager
5 """
6 from RPi import GPIO
7 
8 
9 class GpioExpanderAdapter:
10 
11  def __init__(self, pin, mode):
12  self._pin = pin
13  self._mode = mode
14  GPIO.setmode(GPIO.BCM)
15  GPIO.setup(self._pin, self._mode)
16 
17 
18 class GpioExpanderInputAdapter(GpioExpanderAdapter):
19 
20  def __init__(self, pin):
21  super().__init__(pin, GPIO.IN)
22 
23  @property
24  def value(self):
25  return GPIO.input(self._pin)
26 
27  def on_change(self, fun):
28  GPIO.add_event_detect(self._pin, GPIO.BOTH, callback=lambda _pin: fun(self.value), bouncetime=10)
29 
30 
31 class GpioExpanderOutputAdapter(GpioExpanderAdapter):
32 
33  def __init__(self, pin):
34  super().__init__(pin, GPIO.OUT)
35  self.value = False
36 
37  @property
38  def value(self):
39  return GPIO.input(self._pin)
40 
41  @value.setter
42  def value(self, value):
43  GPIO.output(self._pin, GPIO.HIGH if value else GPIO.LOW)
44 
45 
46 class GpioExpanderButtonAdapter(GpioExpanderInputAdapter):
47 
48  def on_press(self, fun):
49  GPIO.add_event_detect(self._pin, GPIO.RISING, callback=lambda _pin: fun(), bouncetime=10)
50 
51  def disable_on_press(self):
52  GPIO.remove_event_detect(self._pin)
53 
54 
55 class GpioManager:
56 
57  def __init__(self):
58  self.__inputs = {}
59  self.__outputs = {}
60 
61  def add_output(self, pin, name, reversed=False):
62  self.__outputs[name] = GpioExpanderOutputAdapter(pin)
63  return self.__outputs[name]
64 
65  def add_button(self, pin, name, pullup=True, reverse_polarity=False):
66  self.__inputs[name] = GpioExpanderButtonAdapter(pin)
67  return self.__inputs[name]
68 
69  def add_input(self, pin, name, reverse_polarity=True):
70  self.__inputs[name] = GpioExpanderInputAdapter(pin)
71  return self.__inputs[name]
